snippet: Relief would be sent to besieged cities within days, and a “cessation of hostilities” would go into effect in a week, American and Russian officials announced.
abstract: Sec of State John Kerry reaches agreement with Russian Foreign Min Sergey V Lavrov to deliver emergency aid to besieged Syrian cities and create path to eventual cease-fire; diplomats overcome tensions sparked by Russia's increased airstrikes to propose first formal end to violence since war began in 2011; doubts linger over whether factions will in fact observe cease-fire, which does not include Islamic State.

byline.contributor: Michael S. Schmidt contributed reporting from Brussels.

lead_paragraph: Relief would be sent to besieged cities within days, and a “cessation of hostilities” would go into effect in a week, American and Russian officials announced.

headline.main: U.S. and Russia Announce Plan for Humanitarian Aid and a Cease-Fire in Syria
headline.print_headline: U.S. and Russia Agree on Plan for a Cease-Fire in Syria

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
